ai-tha-ap97:1.1_0: “There is no need for the Fortunate One,
ai-tha-ap97:2.2_0: in the world with its gods.
ai-tha-ap97:2.3_0: like Indra, the finest of gods.
ai-tha-ap97:2.4_0: Burning is burning with the sacrifice;
ai-tha-ap97:3.1_0: I’ve declared that fear of lightning.
ai-tha-ap97:3.2_0: I was born in my hair dishevelled:
ai-tha-ap97:3.4_0: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha,
ai-tha-ap97:4.1_0: I paid homage at the teacher’s feet,
ai-tha-ap97:4.3_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap97:5.1_0: and made an agreement for the Buddha,
ai-tha-ap97:5.2_0: I penetrated the fruit of my own insight.
ai-tha-ap97:5.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap97:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Gandhāra.
